img.alt: PCR-3 Recognizes Staff, Volunteer, and Business for Excellence in Education

a.span: PCR-3 Recognizes Staff, Volunteer, and Business for Excellence in Education

div.p: Each April, the Northland Regional Chamber of Commerce celebrates Excellence in Education with a banquet honoring outstanding students, teachers, staff, volunteers, and business supporters of Northland education. While we'll not be able to gather ~1,000 attendees from eight school districts in Kansas Citys Northland, we'll be celebrating virtually with a recorded version of the event on May 12. Help us in congratulating the following Platte County R-3 School District nominees!

a.title: Go to comments for PCR-3 Recognizes Staff, Volunteer, and Business for Excellence in Education

img.alt: Frequently Asked Questions and Update About Coronavirus

a.span: Frequently Asked Questions and Update About Coronavirus

div.p: We have developed this page to share resources and keep staff, students, and parents informed of our efforts, and to answer frequently asked questions with regards to the COVID-19 Coronavirus.

a.title: Go to comments for Frequently Asked Questions and Update About Coronavirus

img.alt: Wind Ensemble Performs with Grammy-Nominated Composer

a.span: Wind Ensemble Performs with Grammy-Nominated Composer

div.p: The PCHS Wind Ensemble performed at the Kauffman Center for the Performing Arts, as part of the Kansas City Classic Band and Orchestra Festival. The centerpiece of the program was a contemporary work by Grammy-nominated Alex Shapiro, who Dr. Jay Jones worked with to create a special organ part for their Kauffman Center performance.

a.title: Go to comments for Wind Ensemble Performs with Grammy-Nominated Composer

div.p: This year's VEX Robotics competition is the "Tower Takeover" and all of our teams from PCHS, PCMS, and Barry School have had outstanding seasons! At the State tournament, Team 8778W from PCMS won the state middle school championship, and four of our teams qualified for Worlds!

a.title: Go to comments for PCR-3 Robotics "TAKESOVER" at State

div.p: Welcome to the Class of 2033! Our Kindergarten Kickoffs will be postponed until a later date. In the meantime, families with incoming kindergartners are asked to please complete the form linked here. We will send you an electronic enrollment packet and will communicate our makeup plans once set.

a.title: Go to comments for Kindergarten Kickoffs for 2020-21 School Year

div.p: The Platte County R-3 School District Board of Education is committed to maintaining a workplace and educational environment that is free from discrimination and harassment in admission or access to, or treatment or employment in, its programs, services, activities and facilities. In accordance with law, the district strictly prohibits discrimination and harassment against employees, students or others on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability, age, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by law in its programs, activities, or in employment. As required by law, the district provides equal access to district facilities and related benefits and services and will not discriminate against any group officially affiliated with the Boy Scouts of America, the Girl Scouts of the United States of America, or any other youth groups designated in applicable federal law. The Platte County R-3 School District is an equal opportunity employer. Inquiries or concerns regarding the application of this notice may be referred to our districts Compliance Officer. Any person who is unable to resolve a problem or grievance arising under Title VI, Title IX, the Age Discrimination Act, Section 504, or Title II of the ADA, may contact the Office for Civil Rights, One Petticoat Lane, 1010 Walnut Street, Suite 320 Kansas City, MO 64106, phone number (816) 268-0550. Click here for related school board policy. Click here for the grievance form.
